taskman

Class Task

  • java.lang.Object
    • taskman.Task
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<java.lang.Object>

    public class Task
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<java.lang.Object>
    This class represents a task.
    Author:
    Jeroen Van Der Donckt

    • Constructor Detail

      • Task

        public Task(java.lang.String description,
            java.lang.String estimatedDuration,
            java.lang.String acceptableDeviation)
        Creates a new task with the given values.
        Parameters:
        description - the task description
        estimatedDuration - the estimated duration of the task in minutes
        acceptableDeviation - the acceptable deviation of the task
        Postcondition:
        a new task is created with the given attributes an available status

      • Task

        public Task(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> form)
     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a new task with parameters from the given hashmap.
        Parameters:
        form - the HashMap from which to extract the parameters.
        Postcondition:
        a new task is created with the given parameters
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when one of the parameters is abscent or not valid.

      • updateStatus

        public void updateStatus(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> form)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Updates the status of the task.
        Parameters:
        form - the HashMap from which to extract the necessary values
        Postcondition:
        the start time, end time and status of the task will be updated
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the status is not FINISHED and not FAILED or when the end time is before the start time
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the startTime if before the endTime of its dependencies

      • getDelay

        public java.lang.String getDelay()
                          throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Return the delay between the end time and the estimated end time in minutes.
        Returns:
        a String with the time between the end time and the estimated end time in minutes.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the task is not yet finished.

      • getAlternative

        public Task getAlternative()
        Returns the alternative task of the task.
        Returns:
        the alternative task

      • setAlternative

        public void setAlternative(Task alternative)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                           java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the alternative task of the task to the given task.
        Parameters:
        alternative - the alternative task of the task
        Postcondition:
        the alternative task of the task is set to the given task
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - the task must be failed to set the alternative task
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - the alternative may not be this task or its alternative or one of its dependencies or one of these alternatives recursively

      • getDependencies

        public java.util.ArrayList<Task> getDependencies()
        Returns a list with all dependencies of the task.
        Returns:
        the dependencies of the task

      • addDependency

        public void addDependency(Task dependency)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                          java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Adds a dependency to the task.
        Parameters:
        dependency - task that needs to be added to the task
        Postcondition:
        the dependency is added to the task, the status of the task is updated accordingly
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the dependency is this task or its alternative or one of its dependencies or one of these alternatives recursively
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the task is already finished or failed

      • restoreDependencies

        public void restoreDependencies(java.util.ArrayList<Task> dependencies)
        Restores the dependencies of the task without checks.
        Parameters:
        dependencies - an ArrayList of Task on which this task is dependant.

      • removeDependency

        public void removeDependency(Task dependency)
        Removes dependency of the given task.
        Parameters:
        dependency - task that needs to be removed as dependency of the task
        Postcondition:
        the dependency is deleted from the task and the task status is updated accordingly
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - the dependency task must be a dependency of the task

      • getTaskDetails

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getTaskDetails()
        Returns the task details of the task.
        Returns:
        a HashMap containing as keys the detail name and as value the corresponding detail value

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(java.lang.Object o)
        Compares this task its ID with that from another task or another ID.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<java.lang.Object>
        Parameters:
        o - the other task or the ID of the other task
        Returns:
        the comparison of both ID's

      • addToXml

        public void addToXml(XmlObject taskObject)
              throws XmlException
        Add a task to an XmlObject.
        Parameters:
        taskObject - an XmlObject.
        Postcondition:
        the task will be added to the XmlObject.
        Throws:
        XmlException - if the clock cannot be added to the XmlObject.

      • getFromXml

        public static Task getFromXml(XmlObject taskObject)
                       throws XmlException
        Restore a task from an XmlObject.
        Parameters:
        taskObject - the XmlObject.
        Returns:
        the restored task.
        Throws:
        XmlException - if the task can't be created.

      • getCreationForm

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getCreationForm()
        This method generates a form containing all parameters needed to create a new task. All values are empty and can be filled in, and then passed back to the task.
        Returns:
        a HashMap containing all elements that need to be filled in to create a new task

      • getUpdateStatusForm

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getUpdateStatusForm()
        This method generates a form containing all parameters needed to update the status of a task. All values are empty and can be filled in, and then passed back to the task.
        Returns:
        a HashMap containing all elements that need to be filled in to update the status of a task
